identity access management: is used to mage access to \users and resources
IAM is a universal system: (applied to all regions atthe same time). IAM is a free service.
A root account is the account created when AWS is set up(ful administrator)
New IAM account has no permissions until granted
New users get assingned an access key id and secret when first created when you give them programatic access
Access keys are only used for cli and SDK(cannt access console
Access keys are only shown once created. If lost, they must be delete/recretedagain
always set up MFA for root accounts
users must enable MFA on their account, Administrator cannt turn it on for each user
IAM allows your set password policied to set minimum password requirements or rotate passwords
IAM indentities as users, Groups amd roles
IAM users end users who log into console or interact with AWS resources programmatically
IAM Groups group up your users so they all share permmission levels of the group. eg. Administrators, Developers, Auditors
IAM roles associates permissions to a role and then assign this to users or groups
IAM policies Json documents which grant permission levels for a specific user, group or role to access services.policies are attched to IAM identities
Managed Policies are policies provied by AWS and cannot be edited
Customer managed Policies are policies created by the customer and which you can edit
Inline Policies are policies which are directly attached to a user
